Ad Text:
Senior Business Analysts  

Location: Canberra, ACT 

Clearance: NV1 

About the Role 

Glic Recruitment is seeking multiple Senior Business Analysts to support strategic initiatives across multiple platforms. These roles are central to shaping the full business lifecycle, from discovery and design through to deployment and optimisation, while ensuring business and technical requirements are aligned to enterprise outcomes.  

Roles are open to both permanent and contract arrangements. 

You’ll work across two key streams: strategic requirements management and cloud delivery enablement. 

Stream 1: Strategic Requirements & Stakeholder Engagement 

Produce and manage business, functional, and non-functional requirements, including user stories and acceptance criteria 

Ensure traceability to strategic objectives and support key decision points 

Facilitate workshops and stakeholder meetings to gather and validate requirements 

Translate complex technical concepts into clear, outcome-focused language 

Align ICT requirements with organisational strategy, priorities, and benefits realisation 

Support Agile delivery through sprint planning, backlog grooming, and release coordination 

Stream 2: Cloud Delivery & Process Improvement 

Analyse business and technical requirements across all phases of cloud enhancement projects 

Evaluate impacts and dependencies across systems and processes 

Collaborate with cloud architects to assess platform capabilities and recommend  

fit-for-purpose solutions 

Ideally you will have worked across AWS, Azure, and/or Google Cloud to support cloud-native and hybrid solutions 

Identify opportunities for automation, cost optimisation, and performance improvements 

Document current and future state processes, workflows, and data flows 

Apply ITSM and ITOM experience to enhance existing services and support greenfield initiatives 

About You 

You’re a strategic thinker with strong technical acumen and a knack for translating complexity into clarity. You thrive in multi-cloud environments and know how to drive value through precision, collaboration, and stakeholder engagement. 

All roles require you have a current and active NV1 Security Clearance, and you will be based in Canberra with potential for hybrid arrangements.  

Due to the nature of these requirements, you will be available to start ASAP, and as we have a strong pipeline requirement for Business Analysts, we encourage you to apply for future opportunities.  

If you’re ready to influence cloud transformation at scale and deliver outcomes that matter, we’d love to hear from you. 

Enquiries: Tania.milovanovic@glicrecruitment.com.au for all enquiries, however please apply via Seek.

About the Company
 
Our client is a high-growth, private equity-backed services group headquartered in the heart of Sydney CBD. With rapid expansion underway, they are seeking a FP&A Manager to build and lead the financial planning and analysis function. This is a career-defining opportunity to join a dynamic, fast-paced environment and shape the future of a growing business.
 
About the Role
 
Reporting directly to the CFO, the FP&A Manager is a newly created role designed to deliver strategic insights and drive financial decision-making. You will lead budgeting, forecasting, business case analysis, and cash flow management, while collaborating with senior leaders across the business. This is a role for a commercially savvy leader who can balance hands-on execution with strategic influence.
 
Key Responsibilities

Lead and establish the FP&A function, setting best-practice frameworks and delivering accurate budgets, forecasts, and financial models that align with group strategy and support high-stakes decision-making.
Partner closely with executives, board members, and senior business leaders to interpret complex financial data and translate insights into clear, actionable recommendations that drive growth, efficiency, and profitability.
Design and enhance performance reporting and analytical tools, including dashboards, KPIs, and BI solutions, to improve transparency, accountability, and speed of decision-making across the organisation.
Lead scenario modelling, sensitivity analysis, and long-range planning to evaluate risks, identify opportunities, and inform strategic initiatives such as capital allocation, M&A, and new market entry.
Drive commercial analysis and investment appraisal, supporting business cases for new initiatives and ensuring robust financial evaluation of growth strategies.
Embed FP&A as a trusted business partner across the group functions, ensuring alignment with overall corporate objectives and contributing to operational and financial performance improvements.
Streamline processes and reporting structures within FP&A to build scalability and efficiency as the organisation continues to expand.
Act as a key advisor to the CFO and senior leadership team, providing forward-looking insights and recommendations on financial strategy.
About You

CA/CPA qualified with extensive FP&A leadership experience
Proven expertise across P&L, balance sheet and cash flow analysis
Experience in high-growth or global organisations; with previous background in big 4 or mid-tier environment advantageous
Advanced financial modelling and strong Power BI/ERP skills
Strategic thinker with a hands-on mindset, focused on continuous improvement
Exceptional communicator able to influence senior stakeholders with data-driven insights
Benefits

Work within an innovative, private equity-backed organisation
Hybrid model: 3 days in the CBD office, 2 days from home
High exposure to senior management and decision-making
Attractive salary package with additional perks
Opportunities for professional growth in a high-performance culture

Classification: ANU Officer 8 (Information Technology) 
Salary package: $118,399 - $126,607 per annum plus 17% superannuation 
Terms: Full time, Continuing

Position Description and Selection Criteria: PD & PEWER ANU O8 Senior Performance Analyst.pdf

Position overview 

 The Australian National University (ANU) is seeking two highly skilled and motivated Senior Performance Analysts to join the Planning, Data & Analytics Division. These are pivotal roles within the University’s Planning and University Performance team, which is responsible for delivering key insights that inform strategic decision-making across the institution including analysis and reporting on a broad range of performance metrics relating to students and staff.

As a Senior Performance Analyst, your work will support executive leadership, academic colleges, and administrative units through rigorous data analysis, benchmarking, and environmental scanning. You will also contribute to the development of performance reporting tools (including BI dashboards),frameworks and reporting metrics.

Key responsibilities include:

Conducting robust quantitative and qualitative analysis to assess institutional performance
Producing timely and accurate reports, visualisations, and executive briefings
Leading benchmarking and competitor analysis initiatives
Supporting strategic planning through high-level modelling and statistical research
Mentoring team members and contributing to a culture of continuous improvement
Make a significant contribution to planning, school reviews and maintaining an up-to-date knowledge of higher education policy, compliance and governance.

To thrive in this role, you will bring:

Postgraduate qualifications or extensive relevant experience or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education/training in statistics, data science, computer science, or a related field, with extensive experience in analytics leadership. Qualifications in Economics, Financial Management, Social Research or Statistics or a similar field are desirable.
Strategic thinking with advanced analytical skills and a strong understanding of performance metrics in a higher education context.
Experience in stakeholder engagement, data storytelling, and the ability to translate complex information into actionable insights. Proficiency in Power BI, Excel and statistical tools such as TM1, SPSS, or Cognos is highly desirable.
Ability to assess priorities and manage competing deadlines both independently and as a member of a team and the capacity to contribute to building a skilled team focused on high-quality customer service.
High-level communication and skills sophisticated organisational skills to support complex school and administrative reviews.

For further information please contact Sarah Gledhill, Associate Director, Planning and University Performance, T: +61 2 6125 9493  E: Sarah.Gledhill@anu.edu.au

The University actively encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. For more information on employment opportunities, contact our Indigenous Employment Consultant on indigenous.employment@anu.edu.au   
 
ANU values diversity and inclusion and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to those of all backgrounds and identities. For more information about staff equity at ANU, visit https://services.anu.edu.au/human-resources/respect-inclusion 

Application information 

In order to apply for this role please make sure that you upload the following documents: 

A statement addressing the selection criteria. 
A current curriculum vitae (CV) which includes the names and contact details of at least three referees (preferably including a current or previous supervisor). If your CV does not include referees you can complete these online when prompted in the application form. 
Other documents, if required. 

Applications which do not address the selection criteria may not be considered for the position. 

Please note: The successful candidate must have rights to live and work in this country and will be required to undergo a background check during the recruitment process. An offer of employment is conditional on satisfactory results. \

CLOSING DATE: Wednesday 22 October 2025 11.55pm (Canberra time)

Description
Play a key role in transforming how we use data science, machine learning and AI to drive smarter, faster, and more impactful decisions. You will have the opportunity to build intimate knowledge of the best data asset in the Australian media landscape.


At the Foxtel Group, we're reimagining the role of data and AI in the media industry. With executive-level sponsorship for innovation and access to a rich data ecosystem, we're building a future where AI delivers tangible and measurable commercial value.


We’re looking for a Senior AI Specialist to join our Subscriber Revenue team. This is a rare opportunity to work with our unique content viewing datasets spanning over 5 million subscribers, and use it to shape how content and pricing strategies are crafted across Sport, Entertainment, and News.


Key Responsibilities
Use Foxtel Group’s proprietary data, machine learning and AI frameworks to optimise content investment and subscriber pricing strategies.
Translate complex audience, loyalty, and content-viewing data into commercially impactful decisions.
Design and implement robust machine learning and AI solutions that unlock new value streams.
Partner closely with stakeholders to demonstrate the impact of analytics, selecting the right metrics, applying A/B testing, and leveraging experimental design.
Champion evidence-based decision-making, sharing insights and helping to embed AI best practices across the business.
Inform Foxtel’s broader AI strategy through market research, a deep understanding of industry trends, and a network of technical advisors.


About your experience
A PhD in Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Physics, Actuarial Studies, Computer Science, Economics, or another related quantitative field (preferred).
Substantial hands-on experience as a Data Scientist in a large, complex business environment, ideally one that deals with audience, customer, or loyalty data.
A proven track record of delivering data science solutions that drive material commercial outcomes.
Demonstrated expertise in applying statistical modelling, experimental design, and performance measurement techniques to solve business problems.
Deep experience designing, engineering, and deploying production-ready AI/ML models.
Ability to bridge complex statistical methods with tangible business value.
Proficiency in Python or R, strong SQL skills, and familiarity with BI tools such as Looker or Tableau.
A forward-thinking, collaborative mindset with a passion for applying AI in real-world, high-impact scenarios.


Life at Foxtel Group 
A career with us means working across one or more of our brands including Foxtel, Hubbl, Kayo Sports, BINGE, Flash, Fox Sports and Foxtel Media. When you join, the Perks at Work are taken care of:  
You’re part of Fox Flex, our hybrid way of working with time spent at home and on campus  
Free & discounted products including Foxtel, Hubbl, Foxtel Broadband, Kayo Sports and BINGE  
Special days away from work for Birthday, Cultural & Volunteer Leave  
Access to our holistic Fox Fit wellbeing program  
Generous ergonomics allowance for your WFH set up  
Company-wide meeting-free lunch hours and Friday afternoons  

A note to recruitment agencies - we have this role covered. There is no need to get in touch, we do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Salary: Daily rate up to $745 incl super
Ad Text:
Our client is currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to start asap for the Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS) Project in Digital & Information.

Working closely with the Project Manager, the successful applicant will support the successful delivery of the LIMS project.

The successful applicant will be part of the Digital Applications team, which operates within the “Build” stream of the Plan, Build, Run delivery model - a framework that guides how they plan strategic initiatives, build and implement digital solutions, and run ongoing operations. In the “Build” phase, they focus on designing and delivering enhancements that improve their systems and services through digital project delivery.

Key Responsibilities:
Capture and manage end-to-end business and functional requirements
Develop user stories and test scenarios for UAT and Go-Live, ensuring alignment with business outcomes.
Review supplier documentation and finalise business rules for BAU handover.
Analyse current workflows and recommend improvements across people, process, data, and systems.
Ensure quality and consistency of business analysis deliverables through peer review and adherence to standards.
Support change activities including stakeholder engagement, training materials, and FAQs.
Assist in SIT and UAT to validate business requirements and ensure readiness for deployment.
Contribute to project initiation activities, including procurement planning and documentation for sole sourcing.

Experience/Skills
Experience with Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) and solutions
Proven experience as a Business Analyst in digital or IT projects
Experience supporting digital change initiatives and stakeholder engagement.
Strong skills in requirements gathering, documentation, and user story creation.
Comfortable reviewing technical documentation and supporting BAU transition.
Experience with UAT, SIT, and release coordination.
Proficient in business analysis tools (e.g. JIRA, Confluence).
Available immediately.
Hybrid work model – 2 days remote, 3 days in-office or as required.  
Please note candidates are required to reside and work in Queensland and a have a clear current criminal history check and references provided prior to start date.

To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link below attention Kristy Coulter, quoting Ref No. 246866.
                                                                                                                                                      
Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

We are searching for a Senior Strategy Manager on behalf of a leading Big 4 bank. This role sits within Retail Banking and is focused on setting and executing the strategy for Customer, Engagement, Product Propositions & Pricing.

The remit covers some of the bank’s highest-profile priorities ensuring customers feel rewarded, supported, and engaged, while also delivering commercial impact through growth and strong product positioning. The successful candidate will act as a trusted strategic advisor to senior executives, as well as a 2IC in key forums, representing Retail Banking across the business.

Key focus areas include:

Leading the Customer Engagement strategy. Shaping product strategies and supporting pricing execution.
Driving strategic planning cycles, supporting annual planning, investment prioritisation, and alignment with Group Strategy.
Managing the budgets and ensuring investment and resource prioritisation is aligned with strategic goals.
Support partnerships, M&A opportunities, and innovation within Retail Banking.
Representing Retail Banking in cross-bank forums and influencing senior stakeholders.
The ideal profile:

Background in top-tier consulting, corporate strategy, or banking strategy/insights. We are looking forsSenior applicants with 10-15 years of experience who can act as a 2IC alongside the Head of Strategy.
Strong commercial acumen with experience managing budgets and competing priorities.
Exceptional influencing and communication skills, able to gain senior buy-in.
Someone who thrives in a lean, high-impact environment, comfortable operating without direct reports but with ownership of significant outcomes.
A demonstrated understanding of the banking industry is required.
Please apply here or call Kylie Mageropoulos on 0491722938 / kylie@lansonpartners with any questions.

About Rapid Circle 

At Rapid Circle, we’re not afraid of a challenge — we thrive on it. We partner closely with our clients to craft tailored, future-ready solutions that meet their unique needs. Our mission goes beyond deploying technology; we guide organisations through meaningful change, delivering real, measurable impact.

Founded in 2008, we foresaw the transformative power of the cloud and led the charge as Microsoft embraced it. As pioneers, we were the first Microsoft Cloud Partner to roll out Office 365 at scale in Europe, earning us the Microsoft Global Partner of the Year in Health.

Today, Rapid Circle is a globally recognised, AI-focused digital transformation company with a strong presence in the Netherlands, India, and Australia. We specialise in harnessing the power of Microsoft technologies — including Azure, Microsoft 365, and Copilot — to empower organisations and their people.

Our commitment to innovation and excellence has been recognised with numerous accolades, including the Microsoft Global Partner of the Year Award for Frontline Workers in 2022, and most recently, recognition in the 2024 Microsoft Partner of the Year Awards.

At Rapid Circle, we don’t just keep up with change — we'll help you achieve what's next.

Why Rapid Circle?
At Rapid Circle, you’ll work with ambitious clients across industries, delivering integration and AI solutions that shape the future of cloud adoption. We offer continuous learning, certification support, and career growth in an environment that values collaboration, experimentation, and work-life balance. You’ll be part of a global team that embraces modern tools, AI-enhanced delivery practices, and a culture of trust and innovation.




About the Role  

As a Power Platform Consultant at Rapid Circle, you will be responsible for supporting business transformation initiatives by leveraging Microsoft Power Platform solutions. You will work closely with stakeholders to understand their business challenges, gather requirements, and help design solutions that improve business processes. This role focuses on business analysis and process improvement rather than strategic planning. 

What you will be doing  

Business Process Improvement:  Identify and analyse current business processes to recommend improved workflows that align with our customers business goals. 
Requirements Gathering:  Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements, ensuring Power Platform solutions meet operational needs. 
Solution Design Support:  Assist in shaping Power Platform solutions by working with technical teams to ensure alignment with business objectives. 
Stakeholder Engagement:  Work closely with key stakeholders to gather feedback, build consensus, and ensure alignment with business needs throughout the implementation lifecycle. 
Project Support:  Support Power Platform-related projects, ensuring tasks are completed within scope, budget, and timeline. Assist in facilitating meetings and workshops. 
Continuous Improvement:  Stay informed about Power Platform advancements and recommend potential improvements to business operations. 
Client Relationship Management:  Build and maintain strong relationships with customer stakeholders to ensure ongoing support and satisfaction. 



What we're looking for

Minimum 5 years of experience in business consulting, business analysis, or digital transformation. 
Ability to design and architect solutions
Good understanding of Power Platform governance
Strong background in business analysis, requirements gathering, and process improvement. 
Experience working with Canvas Apps, Model-Driven Apps, Power Automate, Dataverse, & Power BI
Experience with SharePoint, Copilot Studio and anything AI is a BIG plus
Ability to collaborate with technical teams to support solution design. 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to manage stakeholder relationships and facilitate workshops. 
Familiarity with change management principles to support business transformation. 
Fluency in English, both written and verbal, with a focus on presenting ideas clearly. 

This role is ideal for consultants looking to apply their business analysis skills to technical solutions, supporting process improvement and operational efficiency for our customers.

Business Analyst (12 Month Contract)
Melbourne CBD
Hybrid Working

Our client is seeking a talented and proactive Business Analyst to join their team on a key project that is central to their ongoing digital transformation. This is a chance to work on a high-impact initiative, contribute to new product development, and help shape the future of their digital platforms.

The Role

As a Business Analyst, you will play a critical role in translating business needs into effective technical solutions. Your core responsibilities will include:

Leading workshops and engaging with stakeholders to gather, analyse, and document business requirements.

Translating business needs into clear and concise functional specifications, user stories, and other project documentation.

Acting as a key liaison between business units, product owners, and technical delivery teams.

Mapping out current and future-state business processes to identify opportunities for improvement.

Contributing to the full project lifecycle, from initial concept through to implementation and post-go-live support.


About You

We are looking for a collaborative and detail-oriented professional with a strong background as a Business Analyst, ideally within the telecommunications or a similar fast-paced industry.

Proven experience in a Business Analyst role.

Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to engage stakeholders at all levels.

Experience working in Agile and/or Waterfall environments.

Proficiency with project management tools such as Jira, Confluence, or similar.

Strong analytical skills with a knack for problem-solving.

Experience with Cost Price Quote (CPQ) processes and development of Salesforce requirements in financial, Catalog, approval, integration, and reporting areas.

Experience working with Data (data dictionary, data management, reporting) and Sales processes.

Experience working with the Salesforce and/or Marketo platforms.


This is an excellent opportunity to join a market-leading company and work on a career-defining project.

Contact nathan.wood 'at' aurec.com for more information.

Solution Designer / Engineer - Big Data & Cloud (Contract)

Location: Sydney, NSW | Duration: 6-Month Contract

A major global consulting firm is seeking a Solution Designer/Engineer to lead the end-to-end design and delivery of complex data solutions for a client in the Australian banking sector. This high-impact role requires thought leadership at the intersection of data engineering, platforms, and project delivery.

If you have a minimum of 7 years of hands-on data project experience, including a strong focus on Big Data and Cloud Data Lake environments, we encourage you to apply.

The Role: Thought Leadership in Data Solutions

This functional role is accountable for the overall end-to-end solution design, covering data extraction from source systems, ingestion, transformation, and creation of reusable data assets ready for consumption.

Key Responsibilities

Own the End-to-End Solution: Lead and own the entire solution design, working closely with client architects and providing technical leadership to delivery teams.

Design and Development: Develop, test, and support future-ready batch and near real-time data flows/pipelines.

Technical Authority: Present solution designs and architecture in large forums, justifying and defending technical decisions to senior stakeholders.

Innovation: Demonstrate Proof of Concepts (POCs) and working demos for modern data platforms, Big Data, ML/AI, and Cloud technologies (Hadoop, Azure, Python, PySpark).

Mentorship: Mentor junior consultants within the practice and on delivery engagements.

Experience & Technical Skills (Must-Haves)

7+ years experience in the design and engineering of complex data processes and technology solutions.

3+ years experience in a large and complex financial services organization, preferably banking.

Mandatory Big Data & Cloud Expertise: Must have big data platform delivery experience in a Big Data and Cloud Data Lake environment (Hadoop and Azure knowledge required).

Technical Deep Dive: 3+ years hands-on experience in advanced data transformation, data quality analysis, and using Unix/Linux servers.

Architecture & Presentation: 3+ years of experience presenting and defending complex solution designs to large forums and senior stakeholders.

Preferred Skills

Understanding of Data Mesh Architecture and its Domain Data Products.

Experience in data analysis and data modelling (Entity Relationship Modelling, Dimensional Data Modelling).

Hands-on experience with the Atlassian toolset: JIRA, Confluence, and BitBucket.

Application

We are looking for candidates with tertiary qualifications in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent data/business experience.

At Randstad Digital, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

We are looking for a Team Lead - Business Analysis to support a team of Business Analysts as we look to grow and develop capaability, and ensure the best Business Analysis standards and practices are applied to our work.

This is a 12 month max term term role initially.

What will you be doing?

Lead the successful management and delivery of analysis for complex initiatives, including the identification, assessment, implementation and embedding of fit-for purpose solutions.
Liaise and collaborate with key stakeholders to grow trusted relationships that support alignment with strategic goals.
Encourage networking, knowledge sharing and collaboration across the Business Analyst community.
Lead people - support the recruitment of the right talent, manage performance, and support career development, including mentoring and coaching junior staff in the practise of Business Analysis.
Work closely with Senior Manager Business Analysis to support analysis and resource planning, monitoring, and estimation.
Plan and deliver business process, system and change initiatives including managing schedules, tasks, stakeholders and change.
Lead specific work packages end-to-end, including understanding current and future states, engaging relevant business representatives, producing deliverables and providing input into change and communications planning and delivery.
Manage requirement traceability across all requirement levels (Business Needs, Business Requirements, Stakeholder Requirements, Solutions Requirements, and Transition Requirements) and through the project and solution development lifecycles.
Provide recommendations for improving systems and processes, including experimenting and testing options, performing cost benefit analysis, measuring implementation success, and sharing lessons.
Assist with coordinating dependencies between initiatives, including identifying opportunities to improve both the quality and efficiency of analysis across initiatives in the RAC Project Portfolio.
Conduct analysis in a variety of business and delivery contexts, including Agile, Waterfall, and hybrid delivery environments.
Work collaboratively with business users to identify impacts of proposed solutions on people, processes and systems, and to determine the best solution or outcome.

What are we looking for in you?

Tertiary qualifications in Technology/Commerce/Business highly desirable.
Certification or qualification in Business Analysis (IIBA CCBA/CBAP or BCS BA Certifications preferred).
Extensive experience in successful delivery of complex business-led change and transformation initiatives.
Extensive experience applying a range of business analysis techniques in different business contexts.
Management and/or leadership experience in a large customer-focused organisation in similar role.
An understanding of operations, sales and/or insurance environments is highly desirable.
Post Graduate Qualification in Technology/Commerce/Business (or progression towards) is desirable.
Additional certification covering at least one Business Analysis perspective or aligned discipline is desirable (e.g. IIBA CDA/AAC/CCA/CPO, BCS Certifications, ISC2, TOGAF, Business Architecture Guild CBA, PRINCE2/PMP, UX Design etc.).

What can we offer you?

A workplace culture where our people feel valued, respected and empowered
Work in flexible ways that meet work/life commitments and support wellbeing
Professional career development and training
Free Roadside Assistance and discounts on RAC products and services including Insurance, Holiday Parks and Resorts, Security, Finance and Auto Services
Be part of a purpose led organisation that gives back to the WA community
Opportunities for community engagement and corporate volunteering
A very active Social Club - join one of the most active social clubs in Perth with over 900 members

Please note: We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as RAC reserves the right to close this vacancy without notice.

About RAC
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, RAC values inclusivity and promotes a workplace that actively seeks to welcome contributions from all people. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact jason.crooks@rac.com.au

The Senior Manager Analytics leads a team of Analysts to deliver actionable insights and analytics to empower university staff to enable impactful teaching and research, drive sustainable performance, and deliver outstanding student experiences.

Key Responsibilities
Lead, coach, and mentor a team of analysts, fostering a high-performance, collaborative culture.
Deliver high-quality, actionable insights that support strategic planning, student load, and fee analysis.
Engage and influence senior stakeholders across the University, ensuring analytics outcomes meet strategic needs.
Oversee the development of reporting packs, dashboards, and analytics products using Snowflake, SQL, and Power BI.
Partner with faculties and portfolios to interpret data, forecast trends, and provide clear, evidence-based recommendations.
Ensure strong governance, data quality, and compliance with University standards.
Advocate for a strong data culture across the University, empowering staff to leverage analytics in decision-making.
Contribute to continuous improvement of reporting, planning processes, and operational excellence.
About You

To succeed in this role, you will bring:

Proven experience leading high-performing analytics or data teams in large, complex organisations.
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to engage and influence at senior levels.
Demonstrated expertise in analytics delivery and storytelling, translating complex data into actionable insights.
Technical foundation in Snowflake, Power BI, and SQL (hands-on not required, but ability to lead in this environment is essential).
Strategic mindset with a track record of delivering impactful reporting, insights, and recommendations.
Experience in the higher education sector (highly desirable).
A leadership style defined by authenticity, collaboration, and the ability to build trust.
This is an exciting opportunity to:
Play a central role in shaping the University's student, teaching, and research outcomes.
Lead a technically strong and self-sufficient analytics team.
Contribute to the transformation of analytics capability at one of Australia's leading universities.
Work in a collaborative, purpose-driven environment that values innovation, integrity, and impact.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply, please click "Apply" or contact Scott Kyle on +61 2 8289 3155 or scott.kyle@robertwalters.com.au for a confidential discussion.

Job Title: Corporate Affairs and Market Insights Manager
Ad Text:
Our Purpose:  

Intium's mission is to transform Australia for a clean energy future. 

We’re pioneering transformative change with delivery reliability, innovative problem-solving and exceptional service, for our clients, local communities, end consumers, and the industry at large.

Our Services: 

Intium delivers innovative energy solutions in complex and emerging energy services that support the country's transition to net zero. Including Connections, Energy Storage Solutions, Energy Consulting, Renewables, Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure, Major Energy, and Asset Management. 

Check out our 90 second video at https://intium.com.au

This position is open to all Essential Energy permanent, fixed term and casual employees.




Position Overview: 

As the Manager Corporate Affairs and Market Insights, you will lead Intium’s market intelligence, client engagement, and performance management functions while enhancing and promoting the organisation’s corporate image. This strategic leadership role is pivotal in shaping Intium’s presence in the evolving energy landscape. You will be responsible for delivering measurable outcomes across clients and markets strategy, brand stewardship, marketing, stakeholder management, and corporate affairs—including government relations. Your work will ensure Intium’s reputation is consistently presented and well managed both internally and externally.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead and conduct client and market research to identify trends, opportunities, and risks in the energy transition sector

Manage performance reporting frameworks to measure market engagement, client satisfaction, and campaign effectiveness

Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders including government, industry, partners, and customers

Oversee marketing functions including branding, sponsorships, graphic design, and community initiatives

Develop and lead corporate affairs strategies including government relations, public relations, and media engagement




About You

You are a strategic thinker with a passion for market insights and corporate reputation. You thrive in dynamic environments and bring a strong sense of accountability, leadership, and commercial acumen. You are confident engaging with stakeholders at all levels and have a proven ability to influence and deliver outcomes that align with organisational objectives.




About your skills

Strong leadership and accountability skills with a track record of delivering measurable outcomes

Superior research and analytical capabilities to inform strategy and decision-making

Excellent communication, influencing, and political acumen

Professional expertise in branding, marketing, sponsorships, and public relations

Ability to manage multiple priorities, budgets, and resources in a complex environment

Commercial acumen and risk management capability

Highly developed organisational and problem-solving skills




Required Qualifications

Bachelor Degree in Business, Marketing, or Communications, or demonstrated capability through relevant experience and/or qualifications




Desired experience

Proven leadership in corporate marketing, client, or markets functions

Extensive experience in research-driven strategy development and performance reporting

Demonstrated success in managing corporate affairs, including government and stakeholder engagement

Experience embedding analytics into client and market functions

Leadership experience in building and motivating high-performing teams

Background in utilities, renewable energy, storage, or sustainable infrastructure sectors




Why Join Us: 

At Intium, we are attracting diverse talent who want to make a real difference with a career that matters. We are committed to nurturing, educating, and empowering our staff and providing flexibility so they can perform at their best. 

Our vision extends beyond our organisation - it's about inspiring hope and creating opportunities across regional NSW and beyond. We strive to build a workforce that reflects the rich diversity of the communities we serve. We’re dedicated to fostering an inclusive environment where every employee feels a sense of belonging, empowerment, and respect, where all voices are valued.

Staff benefits are vast and varied including hybrid working environment, salary sacrifice options including novated lease, discounted private health insurance with NIB and BUPA, discounts with partners such as JB Hi-Fi, Apple, Dell and access to our financial wellbeing toolkit. 




Applications close at 11:55 pm on Sunday 19 October 2025.




For further information please contact Nathan Rhodes, Executive General Manager Intium on 0491 213 897.

Find out more at https://intium.com.au

Principal Machine Learning Engineer – Ed-Tech

Sydney | Hybrid | Up to $190k + Super + Bonus + ESOP

Are you ready to shape the future of education with cutting-edge AI and machine learning? Our client is a high-growth EdTech scale-up revolutionising how students learn and teachers teach. Backed by strong funding and an ambitious roadmap, they’re looking for a Principal Machine Learning Engineer to join their growing data & AI team.

Why join?

Impact at Scale – Build intelligent systems that transform how millions engage with digital learning.

Career Growth – Be the technical leader, influencing architecture, strategy, and mentoring engineers.

Innovation Culture – Work with modern cloud-native tools and contribute to an agile, fast-moving environment.

What you’ll do

Lead the design, development, and deployment of scalable ML solutions across personalised learning, recommendation systems, and student insights.

Partner with data engineering and product teams to drive the end-to-end ML lifecycle – from experimentation to production.

Own technical architecture decisions for ML platforms, ensuring reliability, scalability, and performance.

Act as a mentor and thought leader, uplifting ML engineering practices across the team.

Stay ahead of industry trends in ML/AI and apply them to practical EdTech challenges.

What we’re looking for

Deep ML Engineering Expertise – Strong background in building and scaling ML systems (not just models).

Technical Stack:

Programming: Python (core)

Cloud: AWS or GCP (production-scale ML deployment)

Data Platforms: Databricks and/or Snowflake (for big data + ML workflows)

Experience leading ML projects through design, architecture, and delivery.

Strong knowledge of modern MLOps practices (CI/CD for ML, model serving, monitoring).

Ability to balance hands-on coding with strategic leadership.

Package & Benefits

Salary: Up to $190k base + Super

Bonus + ESOP: Share in the company’s growth and success.

Hybrid: 2–3 days in Sydney office, balance remote.

Perks: Learning budget, flexible leave, modern office in Sydney CBD.

 If you’re excited by the idea of building AI systems that truly make a difference in education, this is your opportunity to step up as a Principal ML Engineer in a mission-driven scale-up.

Job Title: Assistant Director - Procurement Intelligence and Reporting
Ad Text:
Are you passionate about making a difference for Western Australia?

We want to hear from you.

The Department of Treasury and Finance is at the centre of Government decision-making. As the principal economic and financial advisor, we provide leadership and strategic advice and influence to support the delivery of services and outcomes for the benefit of Western Australia.

What we do is integral to the Government’s decision-making processes about where and how to spend taxpayer’s money to ensure Western Australians have access to quality services on a financially sustainable basis.

We lead procurement and leverage our buying power to secure products and services for government, achieving value for money for WA.

We collect revenue to fund government services and administer payment of grants and subsidies to the WA community.

When you join us, you can enjoy a variety of benefits, including:

flexible work options, including working from home up to 2 days per week.
professional development, training, and on-the-job learning to advance your career.
generous leave entitlements, which include 4 weeks annual leave, 3 public service holidays each year, accrued long service leave every 7 years and an option to purchase additional leave each year. Access to cultural leave for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.
modern workspaces, where you choose your workspace that assists you to do your best work.
access to activity-based work hubs in the CBD, Fremantle and Joondalup for ad hoc flexible work.
corporate discounts with selected health insurance providers and access to wellness programs.
Opportunity to support our Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP), Disability Access and Inclusion Plan and various Diversity and Inclusion Working Groups and Committees.

The Role:

The Assistant Director Procurement Intelligence and Reporting (PIR) leads the development and presentation of insightful reports and dashboards for stakeholders and the development of services in the areas of data modelling and analysis relevant to whole of government procurement. The role provides specialist advice in contemporary data analysis and business intelligence modelling, reporting practices and data integrity. The role also champions the principles and tools of effective data analysis and reporting to customers and stakeholders to raise collective understanding and promote data-driven decision making.

This position operates in the context of Leading Others. This means you will be required to deliver results through leaders and your teams in a single business area, and by influencing leaders in other business areas. You will add value by providing direction and developing and coaching your leaders to achieve operational objectives. You will make decisions about how services should be provided based on the resources at hand.  

Currently there is one (1) full-time, fixed-term appointment for 9 months available for filling, with the possibility of further extensions(s) and/or permanency.

The Ideal Candidate:

In addition to technical competencies, to be successful in this role you will have highly developed stakeholder engagement and strategic leadership skills to build and maintain strong working relationships. You will demonstrate commitment to delivering value adding services to our customers and have a passion for driving business improvement as well as meaningful and positive change.

How to Apply:

If you think you have what it takes to be a part of our dynamic and forward-thinking team, please click the “APPLY FOR THIS JOB” button and you will be redirected to WA Government Jobs and follow the advertising instructions. If not directed straight to the position, please key the position number into the web search box.

Please ensure you apply before the closing deadline as we won’t accept late, and incomplete applications accepted.

Find Out More: 

For further information about the position please contact Nic Power on (08) 6551 1399 (not to be contacted for Applicant Information Packs or assistance with lodging your application).

Subsequent Vacancies

This process may be used to fill similar permanent or fixed-term (full time/part time) vacancies that may arise within the Department of Treasury and Finance and across the WA public sector within the next 24 months. Applicants found suitable but not recommended for this vacancy, may be considered for subsequent similar vacancies in the Department of Treasury and Finance, in accordance with Part 2 of the Commissioner’s Instructions No. 39: Interim Arrangements to Fill Public Sector Vacancies.

Closing Date: Thursday, 16 October 2025 at 4:00pm (AWST)

The Department may conduct an Executive Search to supplement the field of applicants.

Consumer Researcher



About Breville

Over the past 90+ years Breville has grown to become an iconic global brand, delivering kitchen products to over 70 countries around the globe. Breville enhances people's lives through the delivery of brilliant innovation and thoughtful design based on deep consumer insights, empowering people to do things more impressively or easily than they'd thought possible in their own home and ultimately allowing them to "Master Every Moment".


A career at Breville is truly a one-of-a-kind experience. It's more than working for a global leader; it's an opportunity to be a part of something that impacts people all over the world.


About the role

At Breville the research team is responsible for building deeper connections with consumers. We are a talented bunch of pattern seekers committed to delivering insights in clear, compelling ways that inspire our teams to create products and solutions consumers will love. With a focus on flexibility and adaptability, we tailor our approach to each project, whether qualitative or quantitative, ensuring we use the best method to uncover what matters most to our consumers.

Breville is looking for a Consumer Researcher to join our Global Product team based at our head office in Sydney. This position would suit someone with experience with design, UX, or market research methods and practices, preferably with a background in mixed-methods research. You'll be reporting directly to the Head of Research but day to day you'll be working with our cross functional project teams within the organisation.

Successful candidates will be comfortable leading research projects, including developing research plans, facilitating groups, interviews and useability studies, analysing finding and presenting results. You'll work across a number of challenges, from exploratory investigations of user needs and attitudes, to practical assessment of a product's desirability and usability.

Key responsibilities include:


Lead End-to-End Consumer Research - Design, plan, and execute research initiatives that uncover deep insights about consumer needs, behaviours, pain points, and motivations.
Utilize Mixed-Methods Approaches - Apply the right blend of qualitative and quantitative methods based on project goals and timelines. Synthesize data across methodologies and sources to satisfy the research objectives.
Embed Consumer Understanding into Product Development - Collaborate closely with Category Managers, Designers, Engineers, and Test Kitchen Specialists to ensure research insights influence decisions throughout the product development process
Translate Insights into Action - Turn complex research findings into clear, compelling narratives and actionable recommendations for Category Managers and project teams.
Drive Research Enablement - Support the growth of consumer-centric thinking across the business by mentoring teams on research principles and methods. Contribute to the development of research toolkits, templates, and best practice guides for internal use.
Collaborate Across Global Teams - Engage with Global Product, Solutions and Go-To-Market teams to ensure insights are scaled and shared across markets.



We're Interested in Hearing from People Who Have:


5+ years of experience in UX, design, or market research, ideally in product development or consumer goods.
Strong command of mixed-methods research (both qualitative and quantitative).
Demonstrated ability to plan, conduct, and present research that impacts product decisions.
Experience working in cross-functional teams and influencing diverse stakeholders.
Excellent facilitation, communication, and storytelling skills.
Proven experience mentoring or training others in research methods and practice.
Familiarity with tools such as Dovetail, Figma, Miro, UserTesting, Qualtrics, or similar platforms.

To Apply

Come and make your mark with this global leader by applying today via the Apply Now button.

Please note Breville Group will never ask applicants through email, phone, text message, or direct message on social media to provide identity documents, personal details, or financial information such as bank details.





Breville Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Company Description

SGS Australia is a leading provider of Testing, Inspection, and Certification services, supporting multiple industries across the country with trusted expertise and technical excellence. Backed by SGS’s global legacy of over 140 years, we operate one of the largest networks of accredited laboratories and field facilities in Australia, with a network of more than 50 offices and laboratories and over 1,400 employees across Australia. We are accredited by NATA and ISO 9001, ensuring our services meet both Australian and international standards.

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Senior Business Analyst to join our Perth team. This role will play a pivotal part in designing and driving integration strategies across business functions, ensuring smooth alignment between entities during mergers and acquisitions.

Key Responsibilities include however not limited to:

Partner with the management team to design and implement integration strategies.

Develop and manage detailed integration project plans, timelines, and deliverables.

Coordinate with HR, IT, Finance, and Operations to align resources and activities.

Gain a strong understanding of both SGS and acquired entity’s business and functional areas.

Engage senior leadership, managers, and employees through regular updates to maintain transparency.

Address cultural and organizational differences to support smooth collaboration.

Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies.

Lead collaboration across Finance, Procurement, HR, and Business Analytics to integrate key systems, including:

           Financial reporting systems for group analysis and reporting

            PBI reporting tools

Use project management tools and metrics to monitor milestones and adjust plans.

Prepare and present integration status reports to senior leadership.

Analyze financial and operational data to identify improvement opportunities.

Track and report on synergies, value creation, and business case delivery.

Oversee month-end close processes, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.

Skills, Knowlege and Experiences

The ideal candidate will have a:

Degree in Business Management, Accounting, or relevant discipline.

Chartered Accountant (CA) or Certified Practising Accountant (CPA) preferred.

Minimum 5 years’ experience in M&A integration or a related field.

Proven track record of managing complex integration projects.

Strong project management and change management skills.

Comprehensive understanding of finance practices and processes.

Ability to work both autonomously and collaboratively with diverse teams.

Additional information

WHY WORK FOR SGS?

Working at SGS means joining an innovative, Global company. Here are some of the benefits to working for SGS. 

•    As a company, we have embraced the shift to flexible work
•    Sustainability is embedded in our culture and the way we do business
•    Paid parental leave
•    Paid time for volunteering day and blood donations
•    Corporate health & wellbeing offers
•    Ongoing learning & development 
•    Career development opportunities (Nationally and Globally)
•    SGS Rewards: Our employee benefits platform with access to retail and online discounts and cashback

COME TO WORK AND BE 100% YOU
SGS Australia supports a diverse workforce, we encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities, and cultures – including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQI+ community and people living with disability. Providing employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people is an important part of our SGS Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP). We truly believe the diversity among us will continue to foster a strong, innovative, and forward-thinking workplace.
SGS Australia acknowledges and pays respect to the past, present and future Traditional Custodians and Elders of this nation and the continuation of cultural, spiritual, and educational practices of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

Lead strategic insights for business impact
Sydney/Brisbane/Perth CBD location, hybrid working with flexible leave options
Career growth in a purpose-led analytics team
Permanent role

About the role:

Turn data into decisions that matter. Join a collaborative analytics team driving performance across Workers Compensation and Commercial lines. As an Insights Business Partner, you’ll deliver performance intelligence that supports strategic decisions across Commercial & Personal Injury. You’ll work closely with senior leaders to uncover trends, risks, and opportunities that improve outcomes.

What you’ll do:

We are partnering with a leading insurance group undertaking one of the largest finance transformation programs in the market. This multi-year initiative is reshaping the organisation’s finance, reporting, and controls landscape, underpinned by new systems and process design.

We are seeking a Finance Process & UAT specialist to play a critical role in supporting finance workstreams across process re-design, testing and business readiness.

Key Responsibilities:
Partner with Finance SMEs and project teams to map and document end-to-end finance processes.
Conduct process analysis to identify impacts, risks and improvement opportunities.
Support User System Acceptance Testing (UAT) activities, including test planning, execution, issue tracking and resolution.
Collaborate with business and technology stakeholders to ensure requirements are clearly defined and embedded into design and testing outcomes.
Provide high-quality reporting and updates to Finance Transformation leadership.
Contribute to business readiness and change activities to ensure smooth adoption of new processes and systems.
Skills & Experience
CPA/CA qualified or equivalent finance background.
Strong experience in finance process design and documentation.
Hands-on experience with User Acceptance Testing (UAT) within large system or ERP transformations.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills, with the ability to liaise across Finance, IT and project teams.
Prior experience in large-scale transformation within insurance or financial services highly regarded.
What’s on Offer
High-profile transformation program with a leading insurance group.
Initial 6 month contract opportunity with potential to extend.
Hybrid working environment with CBD office presence.
Chance to influence finance processes and systems that will shape the organisation’s future.
If you are a finance professional with transformation and UAT experience and enjoy working in complex, fast-paced environments, we’d love to hear from you.

Ad Text:
Vacancy Number: 143

Position Title: SMS Business and Reporting Specialist

Employment Status: Fixed Term Contract (1 January 2026 - 28 August 2026)

Department: ED People and Student Success

Location: Preston

Award Classification: Melbourne Polytechnic Academic Professional Staff Agreement

Salary: $140,000 - $150,000 per annum plus superannuation

Hours per Week: 38

Applications Close: Sunday 19 October 2025




Why Join Us

Melbourne Polytechnic has been a leader in practical, real-world education since 1912. We offer:

Industry-led, hands-on training

Inclusive, future-focused environments

A strong commitment to staff wellbeing

A culture built on curiosity, collaboration, and care




About the Role

Melbourne Polytechnic is seeking a dynamic SMS Business and Reporting Specialist to support the effective delivery of reporting strategy and automation for the new Student Management System (SMS). This is a great opportunity to contribute to strategic projects, drive operational improvements, and support collaborative team success in a purpose-driven environment.




Key Responsibilities

Lead and manage the reporting work stream deliverables for the SMS implementation project

Develop and implement a comprehensive reporting strategy

Reconcile and catalogue all operational and management reporting requirements

Deliver detailed reporting specifications, including prototype reports and dashboards

Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to develop and test reports

Provide documentation, training, and post-go-live support

Contribute to project planning, data migration, testing, and change management




Skills and Experience Required

Tertiary qualifications in Project Management, Business, IT, or equivalent experience

Strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills

Extensive knowledge of SMS and CRM capabilities in the education sector

Proven experience in delivering complex projects on time and within budget

Proficiency in project management methodologies and tools

Analytical mindset with strong organisational skills and attention to detail

Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing priorities




Additional Requirements

Successful candidate will be required to provide:

A valid Victorian Employee Working with Children Check (WWCC)

A National Police Check

How to Apply

Click Apply to submit your application through Melbourne Polytechnic’s careers portal. There, you will be able to view the full Position Description and upload your documents.

Please:

Complete all pre-screening questions

Upload your CV and a brief cover letter (maximum 2 pages) outlining how your skills, experience, and personal attributes align with the Key Skills and Experience in the PD

If applying for a teaching role, upload combined copies of your relevant qualifications and provide your USI VET Transcript (if available):

Include the transcript link (from your USI Student Portal) in your coverletter, and upload the transcript PDF under thequalifications section

File Requirements:

Each file must be under 2MB. PDF is preferred (Word .doc or .docx also accepted). Avoid special characters in filenames (e.g., ! @ # % *).

Selection Process

Our process includes:

An interview (in-person or via Microsoft Teams)

Reference checks

Employment and qualification verification

Questions?

Contact: Recruitment Team

Email: recruitment@melbournepolytechnic.edu.au

Diversity and Inclusion

Melbourne Polytechnic is an equal opportunity and child-safe employer. We strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with a disability, people from diverse cultural backgrounds and gender identities.




Recruitment Agencies

Melbourne Polytechnic manages all recruitment directly. We do not accept unsolicited applications from agencies unless engaged through the State Purchasing Contract and with prior written approval.

Step into an exhilarating journey with Velocity Frequent Flyer Virgin Australia’s award-winning loyalty program with over 13 million Members and counting. We make rewards fast and meaningful — from dream holidays and upgrades to retail, fuel, and everyday perks.

Velocity is all about smart, simple, and speedy rewards. As part of our vibrant team, you’ll help deliver unforgettable value to millions of Australians — all while enjoying the perks of working for one of the country’s most loved travel brands.

 

As the Loyalty Strategy Specialist, you’ll help shape the future of Velocity Frequent Flyer by designing and delivering strategies that bring our Member Value Proposition to life. Working closely with senior leaders, you’ll use insights, data, and market intelligence to create innovative and compelling propositions that deepen Member engagement and drive long-term growth.

If you’re a strategic thinker with a passion for Member centricity and creating customer-first propositions that deliver commercial impact, this role will give you the platform to make a real difference.

 

In addition, you will:  

Translate business strategy into Member-focused propositions that drive engagement, retention, and lifetime value.
Apply design thinking principles to uncover unmet needs and shape differentiated loyalty experiences.
Use data, analytics, and Member feedback to uncover opportunities and shape innovative loyalty offerings.
Build and deliver business cases that demonstrate clear value for both Members and the business.
Collaborate with Commercial, Digital, and Technology teams to deliver compelling member and program propositions.  
Contribute to loyalty innovation projects, exploring new ways to reward and engage Members.
Provide insights and recommendations to senior leadership, influencing investment and direction.
Support cross-functional programs that deliver personalised, rewarding Member journeys.
Stay across competitor and market trends to ensure Velocity remains differentiated and ahead of the curve.
ds to ensure Velocity remains differentiated and ahead of the curve.

 

You’ll be great in this role if you:

A degree in Business, Commerce, Marketing, or a related field.
3–5 years’ experience in strategy, consulting, customer experience, or loyalty.
A track record of delivering insights-led strategies that improved customer or Member outcomes.
Strong analytical skills, with experience in frameworks like CLV, NPS, CVP development, or segmentation.
Commercial acumen with the ability to link Member initiatives to measurable business value.
A collaborative, innovative mindset with the confidence to influence senior stakeholders.
Experience in loyalty or aviation (desirable but not essential).

 

What you’ll get from us:

We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to):

Heavily discounted air travel for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year)
Flexible working arrangements (including work hours and work from home)
Discounts on travel insurance, car hire, accommodation and experiences worldwide
Discounted Virgin Australia Lounge Membership
Hospitality, retail, technology, beauty services and wellness discounts
Wellness support, including the Converge digital wellbeing platform
A comprehensive Employee Assistance Program, which offers confidential coaching and support from qualified professionals for all aspects of life – physical, mental, social and financial
Dress for Your Day – enjoy the freedom to wear whatever is appropriate for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you

 

Equality rules:

We’re all individuals. We love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQIA+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family. 

Ready to apply? We’re ready to hear from you. Apply now.

The Company

The organisation is a private credit institution undergoing digital and operational transformation.

The Role

You will play a key role in shaping and delivering business and technology initiatives, including process optimisation, system enhancements and considerable uplift in the organisations lending platform.

Your Profile

- Experience as a business analyst in financial services

- Strong ability to analyse complex business problems and develop effective solutions

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with stakeholders at all levels

- Proficiency in business analysis and project management tools and methodologies

Apply Today

Please send your resume by clicking on the apply button.

Salary: Excellent day rate on offer; Genuine temp to perm
Ad Text:
ASSIGNMENT:
Genuine temp to perm opportunity. 4-6 month contract engagement to start with.
 
SALARY:
Impressive day rate on offer. Immediate start is preferred.
 
LOCATION:
Sydney - Parramatta Surrounds. Free parking available on-site. You ideally have a drivers license and your own vehicle as the location is not close to public transport.
 
ABOUT THE COMPANY:
We have been exclusively retained by a high growth Australian manufacturer who is a specialist within their industry and are recognised as one of the market leaders in their field.
 
With a prominent brand and instant recognition, they possess over 50 years of experience and have significant presence across NSW. They have built one of the best reputations and brands within the market through their high-quality service offering and genuine focus on customer experience. Through this, they have created an amazing culture of collaboration and true alignment of values evident from their consistently high eNPS and average retention of staff of more than 5+ years.
 
Servicing thousands of customers across the region, this organisation has a strategic vision to double in size over the next 3-5 years.
 
ABOUT THE ROLE:
Reporting to a highly influential CFO, this FP&A Analyst will support the delivery of major finance objectives as the organisation aims to continue its growth journey. The FP&A Analyst will act as a true partner and 2IC to the CFO and Executive Leadership Team to provide ongoing strategic support, change management, transformation and efficiency improvements. The ideal candidate will also be responsible for leading and driving new improvements across reporting, FP&A and best in class processes.
 
As the FP&A Analyst, you will take full ownership for the strategic delivery of business results. The FP&A Analyst has primary day-to-day responsibility for supporting business strategies to add value beyond finance across a broad range of stakeholders and providing leadership to the finance team. The key success factor will be your ability to business partner to deliver key results and improvements.
 
This role not only requires an excellent technical and analytical mind but also someone that can think outside of the box and not be afraid to challenge the status quo.
 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Reporting to the CFO and working in partnership with the senior leadership team, your key responsibilities will include:

Act as a true partner to the Executive Leadership Team to support business strategy and financial direction;
Financial Planning & Analysis – manage and oversee the commercial planning and reporting function including budgeting, forecasting and annual planning process ensuring strategic alignment to business objectives as well as partnering with cross functional leaders across the organisation;
Business Performance Analysis - Provide insights and build business acumen through analysis of data to support commercial decision making;
Commercial management - pro-actively driving risk & opportunity analysis, volume rate mix analysis, contract negotiation, trading terms, financial modelling and business cases;
Assess financial performance across the business to devise and refine key deliverables and KPIs to meet financial objectives;
Spearhead improvements and best practise across finance transformation including new reporting, systems and processes;
Work closely with leadership team on long term strategic business plans;
Be a key project lead for driving continuous improvement initiatives across the finance group.
 
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
You are CA/CPA qualified with a strong passion for business and transformation. You have demonstrated achievements and track record in driving best practise across FP&A, reporting and systems.
 
Overall, you have a vision to fast track your career towards a true leadership role within the next few years by proving yourself in a broad finance role in a fast-growing high performing organisation.
 
You will bring to the role strong commercial acumen, vision for growth, and a passion for best in class processes. You will have a track record of adding value through an absolute understanding of key business drivers; the capacity to drive change; and the ability to influence performance.
 
This is a mid-sized high growth business therefore, you must display the hunger, energy and drive that you are willing to be hands-on, not afraid of a challenge whilst having the gravitas to communicate and influence an impressive Executive Leadership team.
 
Culture fit is key, our client is a privately owned, high growth business. The FP&A Analyst needs to have immediate credibility and be able to earn the trust and confidence of the CFO, COO, CEO, the broader finance team and the executive leadership team. You will demonstrate proven commercial acumen and strategic thinking supported by a high level of competency in finance management. You will have significant experience in working with, advising and/or supporting senior leaders.
 
In addition, you will have:

Solid accounting foundations.
Commercial finance acumen with a proven track record of actively driving commercial agendas across the business.
Experience implementing, delivering and managing new systems and reporting tools.
Intermediate/Advanced excel and modelling skills.
Highly developed written & verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively manage a wide range of key stakeholders.
Pro-active and customer focused mind set.
The ability to work under pressure and manage conflicting priorities.
Key eye for detail and the ability to thrive in a fast paced environment.
Superior stakeholder management, including advanced influencing and negotiation skills.
 
BENEFITS AND PERKS:
This organisation will provide the right analyst the opportunity to build the FP&A pillar for the group and be instrumental in growing the enterprise value for the group. In addition, other key benefits include:

Outstanding opportunity to partner with a prominent CFO, CEO and Executive Leadership team and prove yourself in a highly successful fast growth organisation;
Access to an inspirational leadership team who have been awarded and recognised as some of the best in the industry;
Work for a leader who lives and breathes their purpose and values in everything they do having also been recognised in the industry for top class leadership;
Opportunity to be part of a service consumer category that you will love and be proud about;
Be part of a highly engaged, winning team with a genuine positive culture;
Highly strategic and commercial role with longer term future development pathways;
Own the FP&A finance function providing you with unlimited opportunity to make a difference. The destiny is truly in your hands;
A workplace that's strongly focused on customer experience and on the well-being and happiness of its staff.
 
APPLY:
If you are ready to RECODE your career, please apply clicking the link and send your resume in word format. For a confidential discussion, please reach out to Richard Skaf directly on richard.skaf@recodegroup.com.au.
 
FOLLOW US:

Job Title: Senior Acquisition Analyst - Build to Rent
Category: Commercial Sales, Leasing & Property Mgmt (Real Estate & Property)
Ad Text:
Mirvac is a brand that creates and curates better experiences. We are more than developers or builders - we are visionaries, and our ability to see the world differently drives us to be bold, embrace innovation and diversity, and lead with optimism.

As creators of positive change, we see each new project as an opportunity to leave a lasting legacy, delivering enduring value for all Australians. We focus on sustainability, innovation, and shared value, to return benefits to our customers, partners, investors, and communities.

Join us as we work towards building the imagine nation.

At Mirvac, we know that it's our people, their passion and expertise and the exceptional experiences we create for our audience, that defines us.

Your opportunity

As the Senior Acquisition Analyst - Build to Rent, you will be reporting to the National Acquisition Manager (BTR) - New Business. Primarily support the Build to Rent New Business team to execute strategy and key deliverables through feasibility and investment modelling and analysis, keeping abreast of market transactions and underwrite assumptions

Your responsibilities will include:

Build and maintain financial models underpinning new business opportunities and investment strategies. This includes building development and investment models, running various scenarios to test different strategies and producing succinct summaries of the results.
Ensure that each financial model is logic and in line with industry practice
Keep abreast of market developments and valuation assumptions and practices.
Drive optimisation of the financial outcomes, assessing options and recommending strategies which underpin value and achieve a "highest and best use" analysis and best-case scenarios.
Perform project level budgeting and forecasting in coordination with the transaction feasibility models.
Understanding of cash and capital impacts of all major decisions and investments.
Ensure modelling is undertaken in a manner consistent with the transaction structure.
Research and analyse demographic, economic, and planning data to support strategic site selection
Prepare competitor analyses and market intelligence reports.
Work collaboratively with the broader Mirvac business particularly development, construction and operations to ensure robust cashflow management and forecasting in place, building an improved focus on cashflow outcomes.
Manage the successful transition and handover of transaction modelling to development, investment and operations as applicable.
Prepare project new business and scenario analysis and conduct ad hoc scenario modelling and analysis where required.
Assist in preparing investment committee papers, presentations and supporting documentation.
Support senior team members in liaising with internal and external stakeholders including capital partners.

Your point of difference

At least 4+ years analytical experience working as an analyst within the property or capital markets industry, preferably within a development or capital transactions environment
Strong financial background
Experience in building, amending and testing of financial models
Experience or knowledge of development and investment with an understanding of relevant accounting principles
Experience in preparing reports and presentations to be delivered to a range of stakeholders
High level communication (written and verbal) and stakeholder management skills
Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong financial modelling skills in Excel and comfort with large datasets
Understanding of property valuation methodologies and investment metrics
Strong research, analytical, and report-writing skills
Self-motivated and inquisitive

All of these attributes are preferred, if you think you may be the right fit for the role please still apply

Who is Vivi 

Vivi is the only wireless screen mirroring and digital signage tool designed for education. We help IT help teachers help students with classroom technology that enhances collaboration, control, and creativity.  

Vivi exists because we all had that one teacher who changed our life, who went above and beyond to serve as a role model and sage. They guided discussion, connected with their students on a personal level, were just as engaging and entertaining as they were educational, and they created a dynamic learning environment by constantly involving students.

Those teachers are the masters of the social classroom. Personalised learning environments have been proven to deliver better educational outcomes for individuals through increased participation and engagement. To successfully create such an environment requires a fluid, visual dialogue between teacher and student. This is why Vivi exists. Vivi is used by over 825,000 teachers and students around the world and is setting out to disrupt the enormous education industry with our high-growth, ambitious, and creative team. In this rapidly evolving technology landscape, Vivi is always looking for new ways to disrupt the classroom experience, enhance customer experiences and expand globally.

Opportunity Overview: 

The FP&A Analyst will play a critical role in driving financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and performance analysis across the business. The role works closely with stakeholders across Product, Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, Operations, Human Resources, and Executive Leadership to turn data into insight—and insight into action.

This is a high-impact role where financial expertise and business acumen will help shape key decisions as we scale our operations and product offerings.

This role is hybrid and is 3 days/week in-office at our South Yarra location. 

What you will do:

Collaborate with department heads to influence commercial decisions and drive profitability

Provide financial guidance on pricing, product launches and go-to-market strategies

Translate complex financial data into clear, actionable insights for non-finance stakeholders

Lead budgeting, modeling, and forecasting across different departments

Deliver monthly reporting packs with variance analysis and executive commentary

Build dynamic financial models to support scenario planning and investment decisions

Analyse key SaaS metrics including ARR, MRR, churn, CAC, LTV, and NRR

Partner with Sales and Marketing to assess campaign ROI and customer acquisition efficiency




What you will need:

You’re not just good with numbers—you’re curious about what they mean. You ask ‘why’ and ‘what if’ to turn data into decisions

CA/CPA qualified

5+ years' experience in FP&A, commercial finance, or business partnering roles

Prior exposure to SaaS, tech, or subscription-based business models highly desirable

Strong financial modelling skills

Demonstrated ability with BI tools and dashboard creation

Exceptional communication skills and ability to present to the Executive Team

Commercial mindset with a passion for data-driven strategy
